comments.body:
The actual issue wasn't on the stage but on the Java test, I think.

This line was a `committableSource` instead of an `atMostOnceSource` leaving unacked messages in the queue and the buffer size was 10 instead of 1 which might be making the stage pulling one element too many from the source and causing the timeout.
These were the only differences I could find between the scala test and the failing java test.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +266,270 @@    Sink<OutgoingMessage, CompletionStage<Done>> amqpSink = AmqpSink.createReplyTo(AmqpReplyToSinkSettings.create(DefaultAmqpConnection.getInstance()));

    final Source<IncomingMessage, NotUsed> amqpSource = AmqpSource.atMostOnceSource(
      NamedQueueSourceSettings.create(
            DefaultAmqpConnection.getInstance(),
